news.description: Crestone now supports data extraction through BAPI (Business Application Programming Interface). This allows for structured access to SAP data via remote-enabled function modules, providing more flexibility and control in your integrations.

We've added native support for CDS (Core Data Services) Views, enabling high-performance queries directly on SAP-defined virtual data models. This is ideal for accessing pre-joined and semantically rich datasets from SAP HANA or ABAP.
Crestone now supports File Server as a destination, allowing direct export of datasets to shared drives or local infrastructure environments.

You can now define joins using multiple fields across multiple tables. This enhancement provides more precise data modeling and better alignment with complex data relationships in SAP and other sources.
A new destination is now available in Crestone: send your data directly to Azure SQL with ease.
You can now extract SAP reports and send them to any of your configured destinations.
Smarter nodes: use Python code to define dynamic dates in your WHERE clauses—no more monthly edits needed.
We have integrated Azure as a destination, making it easy to store and analyze data in the cloud.
Now you can use Databricks as a destination, optimizing the processing and analysis of large volumes of data.
We have incorporated ODATA as a new source, allowing data extraction from multiple sources. Compatible with SAP ERP, SAP Business One and SAP ByDesign, ensuring frictionless integration.

Now you can export complete jobs with all their nodes and sequences in a single file, facilitating migration and configuration. This maximizes reusability, reduces implementation times and prevents errors.
